config.title: Saropa Log Capture
config.autoOpen.description: Automatically open the log file in the editor when a debug session ends.
config.autoTagRules.description: Rules for automatically tagging sessions based on content patterns.
config.breakOnCritical.description: Show notification when critical errors appear (NullPointerException, AssertionError, FATAL, etc.).
config.captureAll.description: If true, capture all Debug Console output regardless of category. When false, only captures categories listed in 'categories'. Exclusions always apply independently.
config.categories.description: DAP output categories to capture. Common values: console, stdout, stderr, telemetry.
config.contextViewLines.description: Number of lines before and after to show in the context view modal.
config.minimapShowInfoMarkers.markdownDe: Show **info**-level markers (green) on the scrollbar minimap. When disabled (default), only error, warning, performance, and other higher-severity markers appear. Enable to see a green dot for every info-level line.
config.minimapWidth.description: Width of the scrollbar minimap: small (40px), medium (60px), or large (90px).
config.deemphasizeFrameworkLevels.markdo: Suppress error/warning text coloring on framework log lines. Android system code often logs at `E/` or `W/` level for issues that are handled internally and have no user impact. When enabled, framework lines get neutral styling regardless of their log level prefix.
config.docsScanDirs.description: Directories to scan for project documentation references during analysis (relative to workspace root).
config.enabled.description: Enable or disable automatic log capture during debug sessions.
config.ai.enabled.description: Enable AI-powered crash summaries in the analysis panel (requires VS Code Language Model API access).
config.exclusions.description: Patterns to exclude from the viewer. Plain strings match case-insensitively; /regex/ patterns are supported.
config.fileTypes.description: File extensions to include when listing sessions in the reports directory. Reload window after changes.
config.filterContextLines.description: Number of preceding lines to show (dimmed) when filtering by log level.
config.filterPresets.description: Saved filter presets for quick application. Each preset saves category filters, search pattern, and exclusion state.
config.firebase.appId.description: Firebase app ID for Crashlytics queries (auto-detected from google-services.json if empty).
config.firebase.packageName.description: Android package name (e.g. com.example.myapp). Auto-detected from google-services.json, AndroidManifest.xml, or pubspec.yaml if empty.
config.firebase.projectId.description: Firebase project ID for Crashlytics queries (auto-detected from google-services.json if empty).
config.firebase.timeRange.description: Time window for Crashlytics issue queries.
config.firebase.refreshInterval.descript: Auto-refresh interval (seconds) for the Crashlytics sidebar panel. 0 to disable auto-refresh.
config.firebase.versionFilter.descriptio: Filter Crashlytics results to a specific app version. Leave empty to auto-detect from pubspec.yaml or build.gradle.
config.playConsole.enabled.description: Enable Google Play Vitals panel. Requires Play Console access and the Play Developer Reporting API enabled in your GCP project.
config.playConsole.appUrl.description: Full URL to your app in Google Play Console (e.g. https://play.google.com/console/u/0/developers/12345/app/67890/vitals/overview). If empty, opens the Play Console homepage.
config.format.description: Output file format. Currently only plaintext is supported.
config.iconBarPosition.description: Which side of the log viewer to show the icon bar: left or right.
config.gitignoreCheck.description: On first run, check if the log directory is in .gitignore and offer to add it.
config.highlightRules.description: Pattern-based highlighting rules for coloring log lines. Each rule specifies a pattern and visual styling.
config.includeElapsedTime.description: Show elapsed time since the previous log line in the log file (e.g. [+125ms]).
config.includeSourceLocation.description: Include DAP source file path and line number in each log line (e.g. [app.ts:42]).
config.includeSubfolders.description: Include log files from subdirectories of the log directory in the Project Logs panel, search, and analysis. Does not affect file retention.
config.includeTimestamp.description: Prefix each captured line with a timestamp.
config.levelDetection.markdownDescriptio: How aggressively to classify lines as errors. `strict` requires keywords in label positions (e.g. `Error:`, `[ERROR]`). `loose` matches keywords anywhere in the text.
config.logDirectory.description: Directory for log files, relative to workspace root.
config.maxLines.description: Maximum lines per log file. Oldest lines dropped when exceeded.
config.maxLogFiles.description: Maximum number of log files to retain (including subdirectories when enabled). 0 = unlimited. Oldest deleted when exceeded.
config.redactEnvVars.description: Environment variable name patterns to redact from context headers. Supports * wildcards (e.g. API_KEY, SECRET_*).
config.showDecorations.description: Show decoration prefix (severity dot, counter, timestamp) on each log line in the viewer.
config.showElapsedTime.description: Show elapsed time (+Nms) between consecutive log lines in the viewer.
config.slowGapThreshold.description: Elapsed time threshold (ms) for highlighting slow gaps between lines.
config.splitRules.description: Rules for automatically splitting log files. All values of 0 disable that rule.
config.suppressTransientErrors.descripti: Hide expected transient errors (TimeoutException, SocketException, ECONNREFUSED, etc.). Filtered lines can be expanded if needed.
config.treeRefreshInterval.description: Tree view refresh interval in seconds during active recording. 0 = adaptive (3s for small files, 10s for medium, 30s for large).
config.verboseDap.description: Log all raw DAP protocol messages (requests, responses, events) to the log file. Produces high-volume output â€” use for debugging adapter communication issues.
config.watchPatterns.description: Keywords to watch for in log output. Each entry has a keyword (string or /regex/) and alert type.
config.autoTagRules.pattern.description: Text or /regex/ pattern to match against log lines.
config.autoTagRules.tag.description: Tag to apply when pattern matches.
config.highlightRules.backgroundColor.de: Background color (CSS color, hex, or VS Code CSS variable).
config.highlightRules.bold.description: Apply bold styling to matching lines.
config.highlightRules.color.description: Text color (CSS color, hex, or VS Code CSS variable).
config.highlightRules.italic.description: Apply italic styling to matching lines.
config.highlightRules.label.description: Label shown in tooltips explaining the highlight.
config.highlightRules.pattern.descriptio: Text or /regex/ pattern to match against log lines.
config.highlightRules.scope.description: How the highlight is applied: 'line' colors the entire line, 'keyword' colors only the matched text.
config.splitRules.keywords.description: Keywords that trigger a split (e.g., 'HOT RESTART', '/SPLIT/').
config.splitRules.maxDurationMinutes.des: Split file after this many minutes. 0 = disabled.
config.splitRules.maxLines.description: Split file after this many lines. 0 = disabled.
config.splitRules.maxSizeKB.description: Split file after this size in KB. 0 = disabled.
config.splitRules.silenceMinutes.descrip: Split file after this many minutes of silence. 0 = disabled.
config.watchPatterns.alert.description: Alert type: flash (visual pulse), badge (sidebar count), none (counter only).
config.watchPatterns.keyword.description: Text or /regex/ pattern to watch for in log output.
view.logViewer.name: Log Viewer
view.vitalsPanel.name: Play Vitals
viewContainer.saropaLogCapture.title: Saropa Log Capture
walkthrough.getStarted.title: Get Started with Log Capture
walkthrough.getStarted.description: Learn how to capture and analyze your debug output with Saropa Log Capture.
walkthrough.browseHistory.title: Browse Session History
walkthrough.browseHistory.description:
All sessions are saved in the **Project Logs** panel. Click the sessions icon in the sidebar, then right-click to rename, tag, export, or share deep links.

[Open Log Viewer](command:saropaLogCapture.logViewer.focus)
walkthrough.configureSettings.title: Customize Your Setup
walkthrough.configureSettings.descriptio:
Configure watch patterns, highlight rules, exclusions, and split rules in **Settings**.

[Open Settings](command:workbench.action.openSettings?%22saropaLogCapture%22)
walkthrough.openViewer.title: Open the Log Viewer
walkthrough.openViewer.description:
Click the **Saropa Log Capture** icon in the Activity Bar to see live log output with colors, collapsible stacks, and search.

[Open Log Viewer](command:saropaLogCapture.logViewer.focus)
walkthrough.startDebugging.title: Start a Debug Session
walkthrough.startDebugging.description:
Log capture starts automatically when you debug. Press **F5** or use the **Run and Debug** panel to start.

[Start Debugging](command:workbench.action.debug.start)
walkthrough.useKeyboardShortcuts.title: Master Keyboard Shortcuts
walkthrough.useKeyboardShortcuts.descrip: Use **Space** to pause, **Ctrl+F** to search, **P** to pin lines, **N** to annotate, and **M** to insert markers.
